title: The Portrait of a Lady - explanations of motives

content.prompt: It can be inferred from the passage that Mrs. Touchett’s explanations of her “motives” mentioned in the eighth sentence (“She was a plain-faced . . . her own motives”)

choices.label: tend to be adapted to the views of her listeners
often conceal the actual reasons underlying her actions
are usually too complicated for her listeners to grasp
only serve to confirm her inscrutability

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
